text: Robert Bushnell Ryan (November 11, 1909July 11, 1973) was an American actor and activist. He was known for playing tough cops and ruthless villains. He worked in theater and movies. Ryan was nominated for an Academy Award for Best Supporting Actor for his rolein Crossfire (1947).Dargis, Manohla. "Robert Ryan's Quiet Furies". The New York Times. August 5, 2011. Ryan died of lung cancer in New York City on July 11, 1973 at the age of 63. ==References== Category:1909 births Category:1973 deaths Category:Deaths from lung cancer Category:American movie actors Category:American television actors Category:American stage actors Category:American radio actors Category:American political activists Category:Actors from Chicago
title: Robert Ryan
